definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to connect/to relate to/to tie up/to bind/to be (literary)
to arrange/to line up/file/series/(in data tables) column/(Tw) row

sentences.english: Our service is free repairs due to a series of bar code barriers.
sentences.chinese: 我们的服务是免费维修条码机出现一系列的障碍问题。

sentences.english: All participants were given a series of questions about the true self.
sentences.chinese: 所有参与者都要回答有关真实的自我的一系列问题。

sentences.english: Dates become a series of business negotiations, often hard-nosed.
sentences.chinese: 约会成为一系列商务谈判，常常就像讨价还价。

sentences.english: Adds a sequence of connected cubic Bzier curves to the current figure.
sentences.chinese: 在当前图形中添加一系列相互连接的立方贝塞尔曲线。

sentences.english: The process continues as a chain reaction with other nuclei.
sentences.chinese: 这个过程和其他核子一起持续一系列反应。

sentences.english: Robert put the new employees through a series of tests.
sentences.chinese: 罗勃让新进员工进行了一系列的测验。

sentences.english: Next year has been designated as the Year of China-Pakistan Friendship. A number of exchange activities will be held.
sentences.chinese: 明年是“中巴友好年”，双方将举办一系列交流活动。

sentences.english: The Altamira Cave consists of a series of rooms and passages shaped like anS.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔塔米拉洞包括的一系列房间和塑造象像S型。

sentences.english: An outdoor game in which the players drive wooden balls through a series of wickets using long-handled mallets.
sentences.chinese: 一种游戏选手通过一系列环绕来打击一个木头球。

sentences.english: OCD patients feel compelled to repeat behaviours such as washing their hands.
sentences.chinese: 强迫症患者倍感强迫来重复一系列行为，如重复洗手。

sentences.english: The colours used are a selection of lovely soft greens and pinks.
sentences.chinese: 采用的颜色是一系列可爱的淡绿色和粉红色。

sentences.english: Therefore, he facilitates IBM and the software company positively achieves a series of agreements.
sentences.chinese: 因而，他积极促成IBM与软件公司告竣一系列协议。

sentences.english: And we're a delicate species, with a long list of wants.
sentences.chinese: 我们是一种易受伤害的种类，有着一系列的需求。

sentences.english: After a series of losses, Braddock is forced into retirement.
sentences.chinese: 在一系列损失之后，布拉多克被迫退休。

sentences.english: Beware, however, of making all your code a series of templates.
sentences.chinese: 不过，要谨防让所有代码成为一系列模板。

sentences.english: The great arises out of small things that are honored and cared for.
sentences.chinese: 事无巨细，任何大事都是由一系列的小事组成的。

definition: (used for abstract things) a good deal, a lot of
every kind of/all kinds of/various kinds
et cetera/and so on .../wait a minute!/hold on!
class/rank/grade/equal to/same as/to wait for/to await/et cetera/and so on/et al. (and other authors)/after/as soon as/once
to correspond/answering (one another)/to agree (among the part)/corresponding/relevant/appropriate/(modify) accordingly
